title: They Refused To Tell Me Their Username, but This Is the Nicest "Platinum" Player In the World.
body:
Told me this through skype, but I'm covering Skype name so I don't give out identity:

[10/28/2014 02:54:27 PM] ------ : Look at it this way: You aren't as bad as you think you are. Having 1000 games and being Silver still is just the same as having 1000 games and being plat or diamond.  You're both stuck in an elo, and you're both not getting out, or getting better. Just because you're a specific skill level does not mean you're meant to be there, no matter what people say. So no, you aren't bad. You're just under the curve.

replies.body: My theory is that if you think you are good enough to get out of a league, stop playing roles like tanks and stuff and start that carry roles. Mid and jungle are OP AS F at carrying if you are actually better than everyone else at your league. Just pick up Jarvan or Kha'zix jungle or something like Fizz mid and just faceroll every lane.

But I've carried ranked games as Thresh support.
Basically tell your ADC when to enagage and when not to and to stick to you beforehand or by using pings.
Just one good engage can win a game and that's what Thresh does.

Actually you can climb out of anywhere if you play your role better than the average enemy in the same role in your ELO. If you could only carry with mid and jungle where would the diamond support mains come from?
I thought I was the nicest platinum player in the world

I would play ranked but I couldn't find anyone that would help me. I was new. So, after 3 or 4 games of, "go back to bots, or just play normal" I did. And my elo went right down to Bronze 5. And yet I still don't mind.
Yeah it's kind of funny that the beginner level of ranked (maybe sliver 4-5) where many unranked players are put is actually a lot higher than the level 30 skill level.

Sucks that some are just that toxic.  I'm glad it didn't push you to stop playing altogether.  One day you'll be able to keep up with gold/plat/dia.  Just keep practicing.  Some tips, after a few straight months of playing, just take a couple weeks off.  You'll go back into the game having digested all the new things you learned, and your reaction time will be back up to par with the new skill set.  Just keep going!

You become bronze when you hit 30.
Silver when your mechanics improve.
Gold when your map-wide strategy and decision making skills improves.
Platinum when your ability to understand lane matchups and teamcomps improve.
(these all apply to all divisions, but, on the whole, I feel that each point becomes more important at each ELO)

Beyond that, to improve, the two most important things are to:
-refine your champion pool for each roles
-be as consistent as humanly possible.

The only people who are 'stuck' anywhere are the people who complain about being stuck.
Anybody can climb the ladder if they take an analytical  approach to their losses instead of blaming their teammates or calling it an 'off game'.

For instance, when I hit a certain tiredness, I just need to stop playing League.  I become unable to properly watch the minimap.  This leads me to do things like overextend in lane or run in to the enemy team 1v5 when I "thought my team was right behind me".

Stuff like not playing Yasuo because "he's op" and instead playing Annie mid because you have 300 games played as her will help as well.

I'm sure there's more, but that's all I've got for now.

this is so true, I'm stuck in gold 4 because when I win a lot I do 3 things: 
* I play that one last game when I'm half asleep
* I play at my dormitory computer room where only one computer has sound (playing without it really makes me suck) and many has shitty mouses
* I play with unreliable connection
I think if you have 1000 games in Silver, you need to do something different o.o

That is the biggest pile of shit I have heard.

Anybody that agrees with this is most likely silver and doesn't want to be considered a shitter.

Its fairly difficult to rise through the ladder unless you can single handedly carry games. I carried myself to gold with ww jungle and to a lesser extent janna support. Players in silver find it very difficult to fight a lategame ww as he thrives off picks and he can easily 1v2 and even 1v3 if their damage is low enough, And boy do silvers love to skirmish.
1000 games and in silver? Nah, you deserve to be there, as hard as he tried to suck your dick, that's still bullshit.
